CHARLOTTE, N.C. -- The Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Department is warning Carolina Panther fans to be careful who they buy their tickets from. 
Officers say that now that the team is doing well, counterfeiters will try and take advantage of any fan who wants a seat. 
"When the higher demand is out there, that also brings about people who prey on the fans who want to take advantage of them," said CMPD Major Johnny Jennings. 
He says the technology is such that it's very difficult to tell a fake ticket from the real thing. 
"The quality of them has gone up so much over the past years, that it's difficult to tell by the naked eye whether you are purchasing a counterfeit ticket or a real ticket." 
Police are putting out the warning now because the team is undefeated and there is a big Sunday night game, followed by a Monday night football appearance and then Green Bay comes to town. 
Jennings advises that fans only use a reputable dealer, but if you opt to take a chance, he says you should take a picture of the person who sold you the ticket and remember where you bought it. 
"You can also call the ticket office and give the ticket office that serial number from that ticket and they can verify whether it's a legit ticket or not," he said.
